page.title: 17Public Services
page.content: GLASCOED FILTER STATION continued Method of treatment. - The water before treatment is referred to as "raw water" and 14 to 28 parts per million of aluminium sulphate are added to this raw water. This forms a "floc" of aluminium hydroxide which collects the colouring matter in the water and allows it to be removed by the filtyers. After filtration sodium carbonate is added at a dosage of about 14-28 parts per million to increase the pH value of the water i.e. to make it more alkaline and prevent it dissolving lead. A chlorinator using chlorine gas gives a dose of approx. 0.5 parts per million to kill those bacteria not removed by filtration. A new chlorinator with an automatic residual controller is now being installed.
